definitions.definition: set up (an organization, system, or set of rules) on a firm or permanent basis.
examples: the British established a rich trade with Portugal
synonyms: install "they established an office in Moscow"

definitions.definition: initiate or bring about (contact or communication).
examples: the two countries established diplomatic relations

definitions.definition: achieve permanent acceptance or recognition for.
examples: the principle of the supremacy of national parliaments needs to be firmly established

definitions.definition: introduce (a character, set, or location) into a film or play and allow its identification.
examples: establish the location with a wide shot

definitions.definition: show (something) to be true or certain by determining the facts.
examples: the police established that the two passports were forgeries

definitions.definition: ensure that one's remaining cards in (a suit) will be winners (if not trumped) by playing off the high cards in that suit.
